value.verse: Hear my teaching, O my people; *
value.halfverse: incline your ears to the words of my mouth.

value.verse: I will open my mouth in a parable; *
value.halfverse: I will declare the mysteries of ancient times.
we will not hide from their children.
value.verse:
That which we have heard and known,
and what our forefathers have told us, *

We will recount to generations to come
the praiseworthy deeds and the power of the LORD, *
value.halfverse: and the wonderful works he has done.
which he commanded them to teach their children;
value.verse:
He gave his decrees to Jacob
and established a law for Israel, *

value.halfverse: that they in their turn might tell it to their children;
value.verse:
That the generations to come might know,
and the children yet unborn; *
So that they might put their trust in God, *
value.halfverse:
and not forget the deeds of God,
 but keep his commandments;

a generation whose heart was not steadfast,
 and whose spirit was not faithful to God.
value.verse:
And not be like their forefathers,
a stubborn and rebellious generation, *
The people of Ephraim, armed with the bow, *
value.halfverse: turned back in the day of battle;
and refused to walk in his law;
value.verse: They did not keep the covenant of God, *
They forgot what he had done, *
value.halfverse: and the wonders he had shown them.

value.verse: He worked marvels in the sight of their forefathers, *
value.halfverse: in the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan.
he made the waters stand up like walls.
value.verse: He split open the sea and let them pass through; *

value.halfverse: and all the night through with a glow of fire.
value.verse: He led them with a cloud by day, *

value.halfverse: and gave them drink as from the great deep.
value.verse: He split the hard rocks in the wilderness *

value.halfverse: and the waters gushed out like rivers.
value.verse: He brought streams out of the cliff, *

value.halfverse: rebelling in the desert against the Most High.
value.verse: But they went on sinning against him, *
They tested God in their hearts, *
value.halfverse: demanding food for their craving.
“Can God set a table in the wilderness?
value.verse: They railed against God and said, *
True, he struck the rock, the waters gushed out, and the gullies overflowed; *
value.halfverse:
but is he able to give bread
 or to provide meat for his people?”

value.verse: When the LORD heard this, he was full of wrath; *
value.halfverse:
a fire was kindled against Jacob,
 and his anger mounted against Israel;

value.verse: For they had no faith in God, *
value.halfverse: nor did they put their trust in his saving power.

value.verse: So he commanded the clouds above *
value.halfverse: and opened the doors of heaven.
and gave them grain from heaven.
value.verse: He rained down manna upon them to eat *
So mortals ate the bread of angels; *
value.halfverse: he provided for them food enough.
and led out the south wind by his might.
value.verse: He caused the east wind to blow in the heavens *

value.halfverse: and wingèd birds like the sand of the sea.
value.verse: He rained down flesh upon them like dust *

value.halfverse: and round about their dwellings.
value.verse: He let it fall in the midst of their camp *

value.halfverse: for he gave them what they craved.
value.verse: So they ate and were well filled, *
But they did not stop their craving, *
value.halfverse: though the food was still in their mouths.

value.verse: So God’s anger mounted against them; *
value.halfverse:
he slew their strongest men
 and laid low the youth of Israel.
and had no faith in his wonderful works.
value.verse: In spite of all this, they went on sinning *

value.halfverse: and their years in sudden terror.
value.verse: So he brought their days to an end like a breath *

value.halfverse: and repent, and diligently search for God.
value.verse: Whenever he slew them, they would seek him, *
They would remember that God was their rock, *
value.halfverse: and the Most High God their redeemer.
and lied to him with their tongues.
value.verse: But they flattered him with their mouths *

value.halfverse: and they were not faithful to his covenant.
value.verse: Their heart was not steadfast toward him, *

value.halfverse:
many times he held back his anger
 and did not permit his wrath to be roused.
value.verse:
But he was so merciful that he forgave their sins
and did not destroy them; *

value.halfverse: a breath that goes forth and does not return.
value.verse: For he remembered that they were but flesh, *
